bibl.title: Taka Shibata v. Henry M. White. Return of Respondent to Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In Re Taka Shibata Upon Application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Return of Respondent To Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court
Return of Respondent to Writ of Habeas Corpus.
In Re Taka Shibata Upon Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
TO THE HON. FRANK H. RUDKIN, Judge of the above entitled court:
Comes now HENRY M. WHITE, the respondent in the above and foregoing proceeding, and for answer to the Writ of Habeas Corpus herein served upon the respondent, says to the Court:

That the respondent is the duly appointed, qualified and acting Commissioner of Immigration for the Port of Seattle, and as such is charged with the enforcement of the Immigration laws of the United State, and with the execution of all lawful orders of the Secretary of Labor;

That the petitioner, TAKA SHIBATA, is lawfully held and retained in the custody of the respondent as an alien unlawfully within the United States, and is by the respondent held for the purpose of deportation to Japan, under and by virtue of a certain warrant of deportation issued by the Secretary of Labor, pursuant to law, bearing date the 17th day of June, 1920, and copy of which said warrant is hereto attached, marked "Exhibit A", and by this reference thereto incorporated in this return;

That the said warrant of deportation, so issued as aforesaid, was duly and lawfully made and issued by the Secretary of Labor, after a full and fair hearing before the proper immigration authorities and before the Secretary of Labor, at Washington, D.C., upon the matter of the deportation of the said TAKA SHIBATA, and after an
adjudication and determination by the said Secretary court of the facts disclosed at said hearing.

The respondent respectfully files with this return the official file covering the proceedings in the matter of the deportation of the petitioner, as a part of the record therein and in support of this return.
Respondent brings here into court the person of the said petitioner in accordance with the command of the Writ.

Wherefore, having answered fully,the respondent prays that the Writ of Habeas Corpus herein may be denied and the person of the petitioner remanded to the custody of the respondent for the execution of said order of deportation.

Henry M. White, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says: That he is the respondent named in the foregoing Return; that he has read the said Return, knows the contents thereof, and the same is true as he fully believes.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 21st day of July, 1920.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington residing at Seattle.
